# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(join(lines; "")) + length(word) <= text_width
            push!(lines, word)
        else
            while length(join(lines; "")) + length(word) > text_width
                pop!(lines) # remove last line
            end
            push!(lines, word)
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
print(wrap_string(text)) # Output will be wrapped according to the specified width
```
